alert.note: Alert for Routt (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 09 at 12:04PM MDT until May 09 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDMIGHT THURSDAY MORNING TO NOON MDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Colorado, including Routt County. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Bankfull conditions are likely on rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations by midnight tonight. Flooding is expected to begin early Thursday morning as streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall and snowmelt. Low-water crossings may be inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1157 AM MDT, forecast gage points along the Elk River indicated heavy rain and snowmelt. Flooding is expected to begin by Thursday morning in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Routt County, including drainages along the Elk River to the confluence with the Yampa River near Milner. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. It is important to know where you are relative to rising rivers, streams, or creeks as river levels often peak overnight. Please heed local advisories and closures.
